description: I am creating this new workspace for testing purpose

values.text: <speak><s>I'm sorry, I don't understand.</s></speak>
<speak><s>please enter your six digit employee ID followed by pound.</s></speak>
<speak><s>No problem, let me transfer you to an agent who can help you.</s></speak>
<speak><s>I didn't get that.</s></speak>
<speak><s>Transferring you to a live agent to help you reset your password.</s></speak>
<speak><s>press 1, if you want to reset your enterprise password<break time="1s" /> press 2 for other systems. </s></speak>
<speak>I'm sending an access code to your registered mobile number<break time="0.5s"/></speak>
<speak>Did you receive the code? <break time="0.5s"/>Press 1 for Yes or 2 for No</speak>
Please verify if you have received the access code. Press 1 for Yes or 2 for No.
<speak version="1.0">Please read or type the verification code sent to your mobile phone followed by pound</speak>
I can't verify your access code. Let me transfer you to a human agent who can help.
Your access has been verified. Please wait while I generate your temporary password.
Transferring you to a human agent who can help.
<speak><s>No problem, transferring you to an agent who can help</s></speak>
Please verify if you have received the access code. Press 1 for Yes or 2 for No.
Alright, lets try again. Please provide the access code you received on your mobile phone.
<speak>I didn't catch that, I heard <say-as interpret-as="digits"><? $access_code ?></say-as>. Is that correct. Press 1 for yes or 2 for no.</speak>
Please wait while I verify your access code.
I was unable to verify the employee number you provided, please try again
Alright, please provide your valid employee ID.
<speak version="1.0">I didn't catch that. Please confirm. I heard <say-as interpret-as="digits"> <? $emp_num ?></say-as>. Is that correct? Press 1 for yes or 2 for no.  </speak>
<speak><s>please enter your six digit employee ID followed by pound</s></speak>
<speak><s>I'm sorry. I didn't detect an employee number!</s><s>please provide your employee number.</s></speak>

<speak version="1.0">
I heard <say-as interpret-as="digits"> <? $emp_num ?></say-as>. Is that correct? Press 1 for yes or 2 for no. 
</speak>
I didn't catch the access code provided, can you please say or enter your access code
<speak version="1.0">Please read or type the verification code sent to your mobile phone</speak>
<speak version="1.0">I got <say-as interpret-as="digits"><? $access_code ?></say-as>. Is that correct. Press 1 for yes or 2 for No</speak>
<speak><s>Transferring you to a live agent to help you reset your password.</s></speak>
<speak><s>I didn't catch that.</s></speak>
<speak><s>Do you know your employee ID? press 1 for yes, or 2 for no.</s></speak>
<speak version="1.0">Something went wrong while generating your password. Please wait while I transfer you to a human agent</speak>
Alright, lets try again. Please provide the access code you received on your mobile phone.
Pleas read or type your 6 digit access code sent to your mobile number

<speak version="1.0">I didn't catch that. Please confirm. I heard <say-as interpret-as="digits"> <? $emp_num ?></say-as>. Is that correct? Press 1 for yes or 2 for no. 
</speak>

<speak version="1.0">
I heard <say-as interpret-as="digits"> <? $emp_num ?></say-as>. Is that correct? Press 1 for yes or 2 for no. 
</speak>
<speak version="1.0">I am sending an access code to your registered mobile phone. Did you receive the code? Press 1 for Yes or 2 for No</speak>
<speak><s>Please press 1,  if you are an employee  <break time="0.5s"/>press 2 if you are a contractor </s></speak>
<speak><s>Have a nice day, Good bye</s></speak>
I don't understand.  Try saying "reset my password".
I didn't get your meaning.  To get started, just say "reset my password".
<speak><s>Hi, I'm Chia! I'm excited to help you reset your password. Let's get started!</s></speak>
